author: raulj
content: Hey <@!291925846556540928> are NOISE handshakes something we must support by default? we want to restart our testnet ASAP but theres a bug in libp2p-noise we are still investigating. would it be possible to enable it in-flight once the testnet is running?

author: djrtwo
content:
The way libp2p protocols work is that you should be able to upgrade in-flight without any issue

Main problem will be that other clients wont support an alternative so if they join the net, they'll fail to connect to any non-noise supporting node

author: djrtwo
content: The infliggt upgrade of a libp2p protocol might be interesting to test anyway...

author: djrtwo
content: So the upgraded nodes would support noise and the original protocol with a priority with noise. That way new nodes would choose to speak noise and new nodes talking to old nodes would fallback to the original protocl

author: djrtwo
content: And by original protocol, Im assuming secio. That correct?

author: djrtwo
content: So to be clear, for prysm to be an effective testnet for other clients to test against, you'll need the majority of nodes to upgrade and support noise. Otherwise, these external clients will have trouble finding nodes they can speak with

author: raulj
content: Sounds good, good to know that we should be able to upgrade in-flight

author: raulj
content: as long as the fallback works
